ovdesc.p: This table is used to define clearing correspondents for clearing channels when the processing bank is not a direct participant in the clearing house

desc.p: Unique ID generated by the payments hub in order to identify each record in the application.
Record Activation Code generated for the record by the payment's hub.
Possible values:
N - Not active
A - Active
H - History
F - Future
C - Not active future
Record Status Code generated for the record by the payments hub.
Possible values:
L - Live
U - Unapproved
R - Reversed
Specifies the date from which the record is to be considered as active for payments processing.
Date and Time when the record was approved in DD MON 2015 HH:MM:SS.MMM format
User ID of the record approver
Holds the BIC of the correspondent bank that will act as a Direct Participant of the clearing on behalf of the company.
Specifies the name of the clearing for which the correspondent BIC is defined.
Example: 'ABN_FPS' or 'ABN_CHAPS'
Unique ID generated by the payments hub in order to identify each clearing correspondent in the application.
Indicates the company ID for which the record is created.
The value links to the field ‘CompanyID’ in PPT.COMPANY
Specifies the date until which the record is to be considered as active for payments processing.Post this date, the record will be set as Inactive by the payments hub.
Date and Time when the record was created in DD MON 2015 HH:MM:SS.MMM format
User ID of the record creator
